form.longName: PhenX PX510101 - Family History Of Substance Use Problems Alcohol
form.preferredDefinition: The Alcohol Use Disorder and Associated Disabilities Interview Schedule-IV (AUDADIS-IV) is a fully structured diagnostic interview designed to assess alcohol, drug, and mental disorders according to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition (DSM-IV), diagnostic criteria in both clinical and general populations. Section 2D of AUDADIS-IV assesses a respondent's family history of drinking problems or alcoholism (generally defined).

headerInstruction.text: Instructions: Now I would like to ask you some questions about whether any of your relatives, regardless of whether or not they are now living, have EVER been alcoholics or problem drinkers. By alcoholic or problem drinker, I mean a person who..TRUNCATED

module.longName: Family History of Substance Use Problems - Alcohol
module.preferredDefinition: Family History of Substance Use Problems - Alcohol

question.questionText: 1. Has/Was your blood or natural father been an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in his life? (father_alcoholic_problem_drinker)
2. Has/Was your blood or natural mother been an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in her life? (mother_alcoholic_problem_drinker)

3a. How many full brothers have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full brothers, I mean brothers who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as you do. (number_full_brothers)

3a. How many full brothers have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full brothers, I mean brothers who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as you do. (number_full_brothers2_f45)
3b. Was your full brother an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in his life? (brother_alcoholic_problem_drinker)
3c. How many of your full brothers are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_brothers_alcoholic_problem_drinker)
3c. How many of your full brothers are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_brothers_alcoh2_8b1)

4a. How many full sisters have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full sisters, I mean sisters who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as you do. (number_full_sisters)

4a. How many full sisters have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full sisters, I mean sisters who have the same natural mother AND the same natural father as you do. (number_full_sisters2_ffe)
4b. Was your full sister an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in her life? (sister_alcoholic_problem_drinker)
4c. How many of your full sisters are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_sisters_alcoholic_problem_drinker)

5a. How many natural sons have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By natural, I mean those who you (biologically fathered/gave birth to.) (number_natural_sons)

5a. How many natural sons have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By natural, I mean those who you (biologically fathered/gave birth to.) (number_natural_sons2_ce8)
5b. Was your natural son an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in his life? (son_alcoholic_problem_drinker)
5c. How many of your natural sons are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_sons_alcoholic_problem_drinker)
5c. How many of your natural sons are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_sons_alcoholic2_360)

6a. How many natural daughters have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By natural, I mean those who you (biologically fathered/gave birth to.) (number_natural_daughters)

6a. How many natural daughters have you had who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By natural, I mean those who you (biologically fathered/gave birth to.) (number_natural_daught2_fc9)
6b. Was your natural daughter an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in her life? (daughter_alcoholic_problem_drinker)
6c. How many of your natural daughters are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_daughters_alcoholic_problem_drinker)
6c. How many of your natural daughters are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_daughters_alco2_7f8)

7a. How many full brothers did your natural father have who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still alive? By full brothers, I mean those who had the SAME TWO natural or blood parents as your father. (number_natural_paternal_uncles)

7a. How many full brothers did your natural father have who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still alive? By full brothers, I mean those who had the SAME TWO natural or blood parents as your father. (number_natural_patern2_bcd)
7b. Was your natural father's full brother an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in his life? (paternal_uncle_alcoholic_problem_drinker)
7c. How many of your natural father's full brothers are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_paternal_uncles_alcoholic)
7c. How many of your natural father's full brothers are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_paternal_uncle2_865)

8a. How many full sisters did your natural father have who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full sisters, I mean those who had the SAME TWO natural or blood parents as your father. (number_natural_paternal_aunts)

8a. How many full sisters did your natural father have who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full sisters, I mean those who had the SAME TWO natural or blood parents as your father. (number_natural_patern2_404)
8b. Was your natural father's full sister an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in her life? (paternal_aunt_alcoholic_problem_drinker)
8c. How many of your natural father's full sisters are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_paternal_aunts_alcoholic)
8c. How many of your natural father's full sisters are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_paternal_aunts2_4cc)

9a. How many full brothers did your natural mother have who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full brothers, I mean those who had the SAME TWO natural or blood parents as your mother. (number_natural_maternal_uncles)

9a. How many full brothers did your natural mother have who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still living? By full brothers, I mean those who had the SAME TWO natural or blood parents as your mother. (number_natural_matern2_7e2)
9b. Was your natural mother's full brother an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in his life? (maternal_uncle_alcoholic_problem_drinker)
9c. How many of your natural mother's full brothers are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_maternal_uncles_alcoholic)
9c. How many of your natural mother's full brothers are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_maternal_uncle2_e1e)

10a. How many full sisters did your natural mother have who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still alive? By full sisters, I mean those who had the SAME TWO natural or blood parents as your mother. (number_natural_maternal_aunts)

10a. How many full sisters did your natural mother have who lived to be at least 10 years old, including those who are still alive? By full sisters, I mean those who had the SAME TWO natural or blood parents as your mother. (number_natural_matern2_995)
10b. Was your natural mother's full sister an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in her life? (maternal_aunt_alcoholic_problem_drinker)
10c. How many of your natural mother's full brothers are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_maternal_aunts_alcoholic)
10c. How many of your natural mother's full brothers are now, or were in the past, alcoholics or problem drinkers? (number_maternal_aunts2_067)

11. Was your natural grandfather on your father's side an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in his life? By natural grandfather on your father's side, I mean your father's natural or blood father. (paternal_grandfather_alcoholic)

12. Was your natural grandmother on your father's side an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in her life? By natural grandmother on your father's side, I mean your father's natural or blood mother. (paternal_grandmother_alcoholic)

13a. Was your natural grandfather on your mother's side an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in his life? By natural grandfather on your mother's side, I mean your mother's natural or blood father. (maternal_grandfather_alcoholic)

13b. Was your natural grandmother on your mother's side an alcoholic or problem drinker at ANY time in her life? By natural grandmother on your mother's side, I mean your mother's natural or blood mother. (maternal_grandmother_alcoholic)
14. Were you EVER married to an alcoholic or problem drinker? (married_to_alcoholic)
15. Is that your current (husband/wife)? (current_spouse_alcoholic)
16. Would you say that (he/she) is an alcoholic or problem drinker at this time? (current_spouse_alcoholic_now)
17. Did you EVER live with someone as if you were married? (live_with_someone)
18. Did you EVER live as if married with someone who was an alcoholic or problem drinker? (live_with_someone_alcoholic)
19. Is that the person you live with now? (live_with_someone_now_alcoholic)
20. Would you say that (he/she) is an alcoholic or problem drinker at this time? (live_with_someone_alcoholic_currently)

protocol.longName: Family History of Substance Use Problems - Alcohol
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Alcohol Use Disorder and Associated Disabilities Interview Schedule-IV (AUDADIS-IV) is a fully structured diagnostic interview designed to assess alcohol, drug, and mental disorders according to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition (DSM-IV), diagnostic criteria in both clinical and general populations. Section 2D of AUDADIS-IV assesses a respondent's family history of drinking problems or alcoholism (generally defined).

form.longName: PhenX PX510201 - Screening And Severity Of Substance Use Problems Adult
form.preferredDefinition: The Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT) includes 10 screening questions about the use of alcohol and alcohol-related consequences during the past year. The questions address alcohol frequency, quantity, alcohol dependence symptoms, and alcohol-related problems.

headerInstruction.text: Because alcohol use can affect your health and can interfere with certain medications and treatments, it is important that we ask some questions about your use of alcohol. Your answers will remain confidential so please be honest.

module.longName: Screening and Severity of Substance Use Problems - Adults - Alcohol - Past 12 Months
module.preferredDefinition: Screening and Severity of Substance Use Problems - Adults - Alcohol - Past 12 Months

question.questionText: 1. How often do you have a drink containing alcohol? (how_often_drink)
2. How many drinks containing alcohol do you have on a typical day when you are drinking? (how_many_drinks_when_drinking)
3. How often do you have six or more drinks on one occasion? (how_often_have_sixormore_drinks)
4. How often during the last year have you found that you were not able to stop drinking once you had started? (how_often_cannot_stop_drinking)
5. How often during the last year have you failed to do what was normally expected from you because of drinking? (failed_expectations_because_of_drinking)
6. How often during the last year have you needed a first drink in the morning to get yourself going after a heavy drinking session? (how_often_needed_morning_drink)
7. How often during the last year have you had a feeling of guilt or remorse after drinking? (how_often_guilty_after_drinking)
8. How often during the last year have you been unable to remember what happened the night before because you had been drinking? (how_often_blackout_drinking)
9. Have you or someone else been injured as a result of your drinking? (injured_result_of_drinking)

validValue.meaningText: Yes, but not in the last year
validValue.description: Yes, but not in the last year

question.questionText: 10. Has a relative or friend or a doctor or another health worker been concerned about your drinking or suggested you cut down? (others_concerned_about_your_drinking)

validValue.meaningText: Yes, but not in the last year
validValue.description: Yes, but not in the last year

question.questionText: Scoring Procedure and Interpretation: Points: 0 = Never, 1 or 2, Never or No 1 = Monthly or less, 3 or 4, Less than Monthly 2 = 24 times a month, 5 or 6, Monthly, Yesbut not in the last year 3 = 23 times a week, 7 to 9, weekly 4 = 4 or more times a week 10 or more, Daily or almost daily, Yesduring the last year Sum the total score of items 1 through 10. Scores in the range of 07 indicate a low level of alcohol problems 815 indicate a medium level of alcohol problems and 16 and above indicate a high level of alcohol problems. Medium or high levels of alcohol problems are indicative that a comprehensive assessment is needed. (scoring_510201)

protocol.longName: Screening and Severity of Substance Use Problems - Adults - Alcohol - Past 12 Months
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT) includes 10 screening questions about the use of alcohol and alcohol-related consequences during the past year. The questions address alcohol frequency, quantity, alcohol dependence symptoms, and alcohol-related problems.

form.longName: PhenX PX510202 - Screening And Severity Of Substance Use Problems Adole
form.preferredDefinition: The Simple Screening Instrument for Alcohol and Other Drugs (SSI-AOD) is a 16-item screening instrument developed by a consensus panel of experts, sponsored by the Center for Substance Abuse Treatment (CSAT) of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. The tool includes yes/no questions about the respondent's experience with alcohol and other drugs in the past 6 months. It covers the following five domains: drug use, preoccupation and loss of control, adverse consequences, problem recognition, and tolerance and withdrawal. The score indicates the severity of alcohol and other drug problems.

module.longName: Screening and Severity of Substance Use Problems - Adolescents
module.preferredDefinition: Screening and Severity of Substance Use Problems - Adolescents

question.questionText: 1. Have you used alcohol or other drugs? (Such as wine, beer, hard liquor, pot, coke, heroin or other opiates, uppers, downers, hallucinogens, or inhalants.) (used_alcohol_other_drugs)
2. Have you felt that you use too much alcohol or drugs? (felt_you_use_too_much)
3. Have you tried to cut down or quit drinking or using alcohol or other drugs? (tried_to_cut_down_quit)

4. Have you gone to anyone to help because of your drinking or drug use? (Such as Alcoholics Anonymous, Narcotics Anonymous, Cocaine Anonymous, counselors, or a treatment program.) (gone_to_anyone_to_help)
5. Have you had any health problems? For example, have you: (question_5)
5a. Have you had blackouts or other periods of memory loss? (blackouts)
5b. Have you injured your head after drinking or using drugs? (head_injury)
5c. Have you had convulsions, delirium tremens (DTs)? (convulsions)
5d. Have you had hepatitis or other liver problems? (hepatitis)
5e. Have you felt sick, shaky, or depressed when you stopped? (depressed_when_stopped)
5f. Have you felt "coke bugs" or a crawling feeling under your skin after you stopped using drugs? (cokebugs)
5g. Have you been injured after drinking or using? (been_injured)
5h. Have you used needles to shoot drugs? (used_needles)
6. Has drinking or other drug use caused problems between you and your family or friends? (drinking_druguse_caused_family_problems)
7. Has your drinking or other drug use caused problems at school or at work? (caused_school_problems)
8. Have you been arrested or had other legal problems? (Such as bouncing bad checks, driving while intoxicated, theft, or drug possession.) (other_legal_problems)
9. Have you lost your temper or gotten into arguments or fights while drinking or using drugs? (lost_temper_while_drinking)
10. Are you needing to drink or use drugs more and more to get the effect you want? (drink_usedrugs_more_get_effect)
11. Do you spend a lot of time thinking about or trying to get alcohol or other drugs? (lot_of_time_getting_alcohol)

12. When drinking or using drugs, are you more likely to do something you wouldn't normally do, such as break rules, break the law, sell things that are important to you, or have unprotected sex with someone? (drinking_usingdrugs_likely_breakrules)
13. Do you feel bad or guilty about your drinking or drug use? (bad_guilty_about_use)
14. Have you ever had a drinking or other drug problem? (drinking_drug_problem)
15. Have any of your family members ever had a drinking or drug problem? (family_members_drinking_problem)
16. Do you feel that you have a drinking or drug problem now? (drinking_or_drug_problem_now)

Scoring Procedure and Interpretation : Items 1 and 15 are not scored score all other responses 1 for yes and 0 for no: ___2 ___3 ___4 ___5 (1 point for each item with a positive response) ___6 ___7 ___8 ___9 ___10 ___11 ___12 ___13 ___14 ___16 0indicates? 1indicates a low risk for substance abuse 2?3 indicates need for brief intervention 4 or higher indicates a need for full intervention. (scoring_510202)

protocol.longName: Screening and Severity of Substance Use Problems - Adolescents
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Simple Screening Instrument for Alcohol and Other Drugs (SSI-AOD) is a 16-item screening instrument developed by a consensus panel of experts, sponsored by the Center for Substance Abuse Treatment (CSAT) of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. The tool includes yes/no questions about the respondent's experience with alcohol and other drugs in the past 6 months. It covers the following five domains: drug use, preoccupation and loss of control, adverse consequences, problem recognition, and tolerance and withdrawal. The score indicates the severity of alcohol and other drug problems.

form.longName: PhenX PX510203 - Screen And Sev Of Subst Use Problems Adults Alcoh
form.preferredDefinition: The brief Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test (MAST) is a 10-item instrument to screen for alcoholism. It is used as a quantitative indicator of the respondent's alcohol-related problems.

headerInstruction.text: Please select one answer for each of the following YES or NO questions:

module.longName: Screening and Severity of Substance Use Problems - Adults - Alcohol - Lifetime
module.preferredDefinition: Screening and Severity of Substance Use Problems - Adults - Alcohol - Lifetime

question.questionText: 1. Do you feel you are a normal drinker? (normal_drinker)
2. Do friends or relatives think that you are a normal drinker? (friends_think_you_normal_drinker)
3. Have you ever attended a meeting of Alcoholics Anonymous (AA)? (ever_attended_alcoholics_anonymous)
4. Have you ever lost friends or girlfriends/boyfriends because of drinking? (lost_friends_because_of_drinking)
5. Have you ever gotten into trouble at work because of drinking? (drinking_cause_trouble_at_work)
6. Have you ever neglected your obligations, your family, or your work for two or more days in a row because you were drinking? (neglected_obligations_because_of_drinking)
7. Have you ever had delirium tremens (DTs), severe shaking, heard voices, or seen things that weren't there after heavy drinking? (ever_had_delirium_tremens)
8. Have you ever gone to anyone for help about your drinking? (gone_for_help_about_drinking)
9. Have you ever been in the hospital because of drinking? (been_hospitalized_because_of_drinking)
10. Have you ever been arrested for drunk driving or driving after drinking? (arrested_for_drunk_driving)

Scoring Procedure and Interpretation If an item was answered in the critical direction, add the number of points indicated for that item: Item # Critical direction Points to add (#1 NO 2),(#2 NO 2),(#3 YES 5),(#4 YES 2),(#5 YES: 2),(#6 YES 2),(#7: YES: 2),(#8: YES 5),(#9: YES: 5),( #10: YES: 2) A score of 6 or more indicates a probable diagnosis of alcoholism, except for questions 3, 8, or 9, which are by themselves diagnostic.A score of 6 or more indicates a probable diagnosis of alcoholism, except for questions 3, 8, or 9, which are by themselves diagnostic. (scoring_510203)

protocol.longName: Screening and Severity of Substance Use Problems - Adults - Alcohol - Lifetime
protocol.preferredDefinition: The brief Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test (MAST) is a 10-item instrument to screen for alcoholism. It is used as a quantitative indicator of the respondent's alcohol-related problems.

form.longName: PhenX PX510403 - Substance Abuse And Dependence Past Year Tobacco
form.preferredDefinition: In a face-to-face interview, the respondent is asked several questions about nicotine dependence during the past 12 months. These responses correspond with criteria from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) (American Psychiatric Association, 1994). The questions encompass nicotine from any source (e.g., cigarettes, cigars, a pipe, snuff, or chewing tobacco).

headerInstruction.text: The next few questions are about experiences that many people have had with using tobacco, including cigarettes, cigars, a pipe, snuff, or chewing tobacco. As I read each experience, please tell me if it has EVER happened to you as a result of..TRUNCATED

module.longName: Substance Abuse and Dependence - Past Year - Tobacco
module.preferredDefinition: Substance Abuse and Dependence - Past Year - Tobacco

question.questionText: 1. More than once want to cut down on your tobacco use? (entirelife_wantto_cutdown_tobaccouse)
Did #1 happen in the last 12 months? (wantto_cutdown_tobaccouse_last12months)

2. Give up or cut down on activities that you were interested in or that gave you pleasure because tobacco use was not permitted at the activity? (entirelife_cutdown_interestingactivities_tobaccouse_notpermitted)
Did #2 happen in the last 12 months? (cutdown_interestingactivities_tobaccouse_notpermitted_last12months)

3. Give up or cut down on activities that were important to you like associating with friends or relatives or attending social activities because tobacco use was not permitted at the activity? (entirelife_cutdown_importantactivities_tobaccouse_notpermitted)
Did #3 happen in the last 12 months? (cutdown_importantactivities_tobaccouse_notpermitted_last12months)
4. Continue to use tobacco even though you knew it was causing you a health problem or making a health problem worse? (entirelife_continue_tobacco_healthproblems)
Did #4 happen in the last 12 months? (continue_tobacco_healthproblems_last12months)
5. Find yourself chain smoking/using one pinch or plug of snuff or chewing tobacco right after another? (entirelife_chain_smoking)
Did #5 happen in the last 12 months? (chain_smoking_last12months)
6. More than once try to stop or cut down on your tobacco use but found you couldn't do it? (entirelife_couldnot_cutout_tobacco)
Did #6 happen in the last 12 months? (couldnot_cutout_tobacco_last12months)
Many people experience problems on occasions when they stop or cut down on their tobacco use. After stopping or cutting down on your tobacco use, did you EVER (question_7_510403)
7a. Feel depressed (after_stopping_depressed)
Did #7a happen in the last 12 months? (after_stopping_depressed_last12months)
7b. Have difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep? (after_stopping_sleepless)
Did #7b happen in the last 12 months? (after_stopping_sleepless_last12months)
7c. Have difficulty concentrating? (after_stopping_difficulty_concentrating)
Did #7c this happen in the last 12 months? (after_stopping_difficulty_concentrating_last12months)
7d. Eat more than usual or gain weight? (after_stopping_gain_weight)
Did #7d happen in the last 12 months? (after_stopping_gain_weight_last12months)
7e. Become easily irritated, angry, or frustrated? (after_stopping_angry_frustrated)
Did #7e happen in the last 12 months? (after_stopping_angry_frustrated_last12months)
7f. Feel anxious or nervous? (after_stopping_anxious_nervous)
Did #7f happen in the last 12 months? (after_stopping_anxious_nervous_last12months)
7g. Feel your heart beating more slowly than usual? (after_stopping_slow_heartbeat)
Did #7g happen in the last 12 months? (after_stopping_slow_heartbeat_last12months)
7h. Feel more restless than usual? (after_stopping_restless)
Did #7h happen in the last 12 months? (after_stopping_restless_last12months)
CHECK ITEM 3.4: Are at least 2 items marked Yes in 7 a. 7 h.? (check_item)

7i. You just mentioned that you had some experiences after stopping or cutting down on your tobacco use in the last 12 months. Were any of these experiences very uncomfortable or upsetting to you or did they cause problems in your life like at work or school or with family or friends? (experiences_causeproblems_workschool)
7j. Did you use tobacco in the last 12 months to keep from having any of these experiences? (use_tobacco_prevent_problems)
8. Wake up in the middle of the night to use tobacco? (wake_up_use_tobacco)
Did #8 happen in the last 12 months? (wake_up_use_tobacco_last12months)
9. Often use tobacco just after getting up or shortly after getting up in the morning? (use_tobacco_upon_waking)
Did #9 happen in the last 12 months? (use_tobacco_upon_waking_last12months)
10. Find yourself using tobacco JUST AFTER being in a situation where tobacco use was not permitted like after being on a plane, at a meeting, or shopping at the mall? (use_tobacco_just_after)
Did #10 happen in the last 12 months? (use_tobacco_just_after_last12months)
11. Find that you had to use much more tobacco than you once did to get the effect you wanted? (use_more_tobacco_effect)
Did #11 happen in the last 12 months? (use_more_tobacco_effect_last12months)
12. Increase your use of tobacco by at least 50 percent? (use_50percent_more_tobacco)
Did #12 happen in the last 12 months? (use_50percent_more_tobacco_last12months)
13. Have a period when you often used tobacco more than you intended to? (use_more_tobacco_thanintended)
Did #13 happen in the last 12 months? (use_more_tobacco_thanintended_last12months)
14. Continue to use tobacco even though it made you nervous, jittery, anxious, or depressed? (continue_tobacco_made_nervous)
Did #14 happen in the last 12 months? (continue_tobacco_made_nervous_last12months)

protocol.longName: Substance Abuse and Dependence - Past Year - Tobacco
protocol.preferredDefinition: In a face-to-face interview, the respondent is asked several questions about nicotine dependence during the past 12 months. These responses correspond with criteria from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) (American Psychiatric Association, 1994). The questions encompass nicotine from any source (e.g., cigarettes, cigars, a pipe, snuff, or chewing tobacco).

form.preferredDefinition: The purpose of this protocol is to measure the concentration of alcohol (ethanol) in the participant's breath.After 20 minutes of observation, the participant blows steadily into a device called a breathalyzer used to measure the breath alcohol concentration. The result is measured in grams of alcohol per 210 liters of breath, which is used as a proxy for blood alcohol concentration (BAC). A person's BAC is equivalent to the percent by weight of alcohol in a person's blood based upon grams of alcohol per 100 ml of blood.

headerInstruction.text: Follow the breathalyzer manufacturer's instructions. Explain to the participant that you are about to obtain his/her blood alcohol reading with a breathalyzer device. Also explain that you need to observe him/her for 20 minutes before the test..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Document the time that the observation began. Am/pm (time_observation_began_ampm)
Document the time that the observation began. time (time_observation_began)
Document the time that the observation ended. Am/pm (time_observation_ended_ampm)
Document the time that the observation ended. time (time_observation_ended)
(Ask participant) Have you belched, burped, regurgitated, or taken a drink of anything in the past 20 minutes? (belched_burped_regurgitated_drank1)
(Ask participant) Have you belched, burped, regurgitated, or taken a drink of anything in the past 2 minutes? (belched_burped_regurgitated_drank2)
Ask participant to blow steadily into the breathalyzer a second time. Record this result. (breathalyzer_result)
(Ask participant) Have you belched, burped, regurgitated, or taken a drink of anything in the past 2 minutes? (belched_burped_regurgitated_drank3)
Ask participant to blow steadily into the breathalyzer a second time. Record this result. (breathalyzer_result_3)

Interpretation of Results : A person's blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is related to a number of factors including the quantity of alcohol consumed, rate of consumption, gender, weight, and prior ingestion of food (Hingson et al., 1999 see Figure 1, p. 32). All states in the United States have adopted 0.08% (80 mg/dl) as the legal BAC limit for operating a motor vehicle for drivers aged 21 years or older (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, 2011). However, drivers younger than 21 are not allowed to operate a motor vehicle with any level of alcohol in their system. The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) approves "evidential breath testing devices" (EBTs) with reliable results of 0.02% or greater. Although many breathalyzers measure BACs below 0.02% it is considered the lowest positive value. Note: Legal limits do not define a level below which it is safe to operate a vehicle or engage in some other activity. Impairment due to alcohol use can occur at levels well below the legal limit, starting at 0.01% (National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism, 1994), and the level of impairment is positively related to BAC level. The following website link is for a table that generally summarizes these impairments, although the exact clinical presentation is highly varied by individual (Virginia Tech University, 2011): http://www.alcohol.vt.edu/Students/alcoholEffects/index.htm. (interpretation_510501)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The purpose of this protocol is to measure the concentration of alcohol (ethanol) in the participant's breath.After 20 minutes of observation, the participant blows steadily into a device called a breathalyzer used to measure the breath alcohol concentration. The result is measured in grams of alcohol per 210 liters of breath, which is used as a proxy for blood alcohol concentration (BAC). A person's BAC is equivalent to the percent by weight of alcohol in a person's blood based upon grams of alcohol per 100 ml of blood.

form.longName: PhenX PX510401 - Substance Abuse And Dependence Past Year Alcohol
form.preferredDefinition: In a face-to-face interview, the respondent is asked several questions about alcohol abuse and dependence during the past 12 months. These responses correspond with criteria from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) (American Psychiatric Association, 1994).

headerInstruction.text: I'm going to read you a list of experiences that many people have reported in connection with their drinking. As I read each experience, please tell me if this has EVER happened to you. In your ENTIRE LIFE, did you EVER

module.longName: Substance Abuse and Dependence - Past Year - Alcohol
module.preferredDefinition: Substance Abuse and Dependence - Past Year - Alcohol

question.questionText: 1. Find that your usual number of drinks had much less effect on you than it once did? (entirelife_number_drinks_less_effect)
1a. Did #1 happen in the last 12 months? (number_drinks_less_effect_last12months)
2. Find that you had to drink much more than you once did to get the effect you wanted? (entirelife_drink_more_for_effect)
2a. Did #2 happen in the last 12 months? (drink_more_for_effect_last12months)

3. Drink as much as a fifth of liquor in one day, that would be about 20 drinks, or 3 bottles of wine, or as much as 3 sixpacks of beer in a single day? (entirelife_fifthofliquor_20drinks_3sixpacks_oneday)
3a. Did #3 happen in the last 12 months? (fifthofliquor_20drinks_3sixpacks_oneday_last12months)
4. Increase your drinking because the amount you used to drink didn't give you the same effect anymore? (entirelife_increase_drinking_forsameeffect)
4a. Did #4 in the last 12 months? (increase_drinking_forsameeffect_last12months)
5. More than once want to stop or cut down on your drinking? (entirelife_want_to_stop_drinking)
5a. Did #5 happen in the last 12 months? (want_to_stop_drinking_last12months)
6. More than once TRY to stop or cut down on your drinking but found you couldn't do it? (entirelife_couldnot_stop_drinking)
6a. Did #6 happen in the last 12 months? (couldnot_stop_drinking_last_12_months)
7. Have a period when you ended up drinking more than you meant to? (entirelife_drinking_more_than_meant)
7a. Did #7 happen in the last 12 months? (drinking_more_than_meant_last12months)
8. Have a period when you kept on drinking for longer than you had intended to? (entirelife_drinking_longer_than_intended)
8a. Did #8 happen in the last 12 months? (drinking_longer_than_intended_last12months)

9. The next few questions are about the bad aftereffects of drinking that people may have when the effects of alcohol are wearing off. This includes the morning after drinking or in the first few days after stopping or cutting down. Did you EVER...... (questions_510401)
9a. Have trouble falling asleep or staying asleep when the effects of alcohol were wearing off? (aftereffects_trouble_sleeping)
Did #9a happen in the last 12 months? (aftereffects_trouble_sleeping_last12months)
9b. Find yourself shaking when the effects of alcohol were wearing off? (aftereffects_shaking)
Did #9b happen in the last 12 months? (aftereffects_shaking_last12months)
9c. Feel anxious or nervous when the effects of alcohol were wearing off? (aftereffects_anxious)
Did #9c happen in the last 12 months? (aftereffects_anxious_last12months)
9d. Feel sick to your stomach or vomit when the effects of alcohol were wearing off? (aftereffects_nausea_vomiting)
Did #9d happen in the last 12 months? (aftereffects_nausea_vomiting_last12months)
9e. Feel more restless than is usual for you when the effects of alcohol were wearing off? (aftereffects_restless)
Did #9e happen in the last 12 months? (aftereffects_restless_last12months)
9f. Find yourself sweating or your heart beating fast when the effects of alcohol were wearing off? (aftereffects_sweating)
Did #9f happen in the last 12 months? (aftereffects_sweating_last12months)
9g. See, feel, or hear things that weren't really there when the effects of alcohol were wearing off? (aftereffects_sweating_hallucinations)
Did #9g happen in the last 12 months? (aftereffects_sweating_hallucinations_last12months)
9h. Have fits or seizures when the effects of alcohol were wearing off? (aftereffects_seizures)
Did #9h happen in the last 12 months? (aftereffects_seizures_last12months)
9i. Have very bad headaches when the effects of alcohol were wearing off? (aftereffects_headaches)
Did #9i happen in the last 12 months? (aftereffects_headaches_last12months)
Are at least 2 items marked yes in 9a. 9i.? (two_items_marked)

9j. You just mentioned that you had experienced some bad physical aftereffects of drinking in the last 12 months. Were any of these bad aftereffects uncomfortable or upsetting to you or did they cause problems in your life like at work or school or with family or friends? (aftereffects_uncomfortableupsetting_causeproblems)
10. Did you ever........Take a drink or use any drug or medicine, other than aspirin, Advil or Tylenol, to GET OVER any of the bad aftereffects of drinking? (drug_medicine_for_aftereffects)
10a. Did #10 happen in the last 12 months? (drug_medicine_for_aftereffects_last12months)

11. Did you ever.......Take a drink or use any drug or medicine, other than aspirin, Advil or Tylenol, to KEEP FROM having any of these bad aftereffects of drinking? (drug_medicine_prevent_aftereffects)
11a. Did #11 happen in the last 12 months? (drug_medicine_prevent_aftereffects_last12months)
12. Did you ever.......Have a period when you spent a lot of time drinking? (period_lotoftime_drinking)
12a. Did #12 happen in the last 12 months? (period_lotoftime_drinking_last12months)
13. Did you ever.......Have a period when you spent a lot of time being sick or getting over the bad aftereffects of drinking? (period_getting_over_aftereffects)
13a. Did #13 happen in the last 12 months? (period_getting_over_aftereffects_last12months)
14. Did you ever.......Give up or cut down on activities that were important to you in order to drink like work, school, or associating with friends or relatives? (cut_down_important_activities)
14a. Did #14 happen in the last 12 months? (cut_down_important_activities_last12months)
15. Did you ever.......Give up or cut down on activities that you were interested in or that gave you pleasure in order to drink? (cut_down_interested_activities)
15a. Did #15 happen in the last 12 months? (cut_down_interested_activities_last12months)
16. Did you ever.......Continue to drink even though you knew it was making you feel depressed, uninterested in things, or suspicious or distrustful of other people? (continue_todrink_depressed)
16a. Did #16 happen in the last 12 months? (continue_todrink_depressed_last12months)
17. Did you ever.......Continue to drink even though you knew it was causing you a health problem or making a health problem worse? (continue_todrink_healthproblems)
17a. Did #17 happen in the last 12 months? (continue_todrink_healthproblems_last12months)

18. Did you ever.......Continue to drink even though you had experienced a prior blackout, that is, awakened the next day not being able to remember some of the things you did while drinking or after drinking? (continue_todrink_blackout)
18a. Did #18 happen in the last 12 months? (continue_todrink_blackout_last12months)
19. Did you ever.......Have a period when your drinking or being sick from drinking often interfered with taking care of your home or family? (period_drinking_interfere_homeorfamily)
19a. Did #19 happen in the last 12 months? (period_drinking_interfere_homeorfamily_last12months)

20. Did you ever.......Have job or school troubles because of your drinking or being sick from drinking like missing too much work, not doing your work well, being demoted or losing a job, or being suspended, expelled, or dropping out of school? (period_drinking_interfere_joborschool)
20a. Did #20 happen in the last 12 months? (period_drinking_interfere_joborschool_last12months)
21. Did you ever.......More than once drive a car or other vehicle WHILE you were drinking? (morethanonce_drive_while_drinking)
21a. Did #21 happen in the last 12 months? (morethanonce_drive_while_drinking_last12months)
22. Did you ever.......More than once ride in a car or other vehicle as a passenger WHILE the driver was drinking? (morethanonce_ride_while_driverdrinking)
22a. Did #22 happen in the last 12 months? (morethanonce_ride_while_driverdrinking_last12months)
23. Did you ever.......More than once drive a car, motorcycle, truck, boat, or other vehicle after having too much to drink? (morethanonce_drive_after_drinking)
23a. Did #23 happen in the last 12 months? (morethanonce_drive_after_drinking_last12months)

24. Did you ever.......Get into situations while drinking or after drinking that increased your chances of getting hurt like swimming, using machinery, or walking in a dangerous area or around heaving traffic? (situations_for_getting_hurt)
24a. Did #24 happen in the last 12 months? (situations_for_getting_hurt_last12months)
25. Did you ever.......Continue to drink even though you knew it was causing you trouble with your family or friends? (continuedrinking_eventhough_causing_familytrouble)
25a. Did #25 happen in the last 12 months? (continuedrinking_eventhough_causing_familytrouble_last12months)
26. Did you ever.......Get into physical fights while drinking or right after drinking? (physical_fights)
26a. Did #26 happen in the last 12 months? (physical_fights_last12months)
27. Did you ever.......Get arrested, held at a police station, or have any other legal problems because of your drinking? (legal_problems)
27a. Did #27 happen in the last 12 months? (legal_problems_last12months)
28. Did you ever.......Find that you could drink much LESS than you once did to get the effect you wanted? (drink_less_for_effect)
28a. Did #28 happen in the last 12 months? (drink_less_for_effect_last12months)
29. Did you ever.......Ride in a car as a passenger while you were drinking? (passenger_while_drinking)
29a. Did #29 happen in the last 12 months? (passenger_while_drinking_last12months)

protocol.longName: Substance Abuse and Dependence - Past Year - Alcohol
protocol.preferredDefinition: In a face-to-face interview, the respondent is asked several questions about alcohol abuse and dependence during the past 12 months. These responses correspond with criteria from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) (American Psychiatric Association, 1994).
